p:
These experiments revealed that N 2 fixers were essential for C accumulation via the low latitudes. If N 2 fixers were removed and the NO 3 reservoir remained constant, greater Fe supply did not cause respired C storage (ones in Fig. 3a). Insensitivity to Fe supply was due to widespread NO 3 limitation of lower latitude ecosystems
15 . The simple addition of N 2 fixers without changes in Fe increased NO 3 supply to surface waters (Supplementary Fig. 9) and increased PO 4 utilisation between 40°S and 40°N by 7%. Dinitrogen fixers were, therefore, able to provide significant gains to the oceanic C store over millennia, which extends insights of in situ studies
20– 23 and prior modelling
30 to the scale of the glacial cycles, as originally proposed by Falkowski
17 .
